availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph M. Willemin (Covington, Kentucky, tailor and soldier)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, tailor and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Nancy Willemin. Father of Malinda Willemin, Ella Willemin, Athalia R. Willemin, and Katie Willemin. Tailor in Jefferson County, Ohio, in 1850. Tailor in Covington, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from October 6, 1862 to July 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Jefferson County, Steubenville, p. 6B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 5, p. 746.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Casons Precinct, p. 116A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0113.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 292.
